data.title: Blyth Spartans AFC
data.meta_description: Official website of Blyth Spartans AFC, the most famous non-league club in the world.
data.text:
Local Photographer Kris Hodgetts captured Blyth’s first home game in 7 weeks as we hosted Kidderminster Harriers. A narrow 2-1 defeat saw the away team take all 3 points as they stay well in the play off places, Here are a selected few image’s and a link to the full album: https://khodgetts.wixsite.com/blyth-spartans-v-26

1899 Club | The three winners of the prizes for March are: 262 | Zoe Hedley – Winner of £100 103 | Lee Anderson – Winner of a Pair of Sponsor Tickets for a Blyth Spartans Home Game 204 | Martin Hunter – Winner of a Pair of Tickets for a Blyth Spartans Home Game. #HowayBlyth

A selection of images by Bill Broadley from the game between Blyth Spartans and Kidderminster Harriers, which saw the Spartans crash to a fifth consecutive league defeat by a single goal in a closely fought game.

Report by Stuart Dick In association with: Alan McLean FCMA CGMA Chartered Management Consultant Vanarama National League North Saturday 7th April 2018 Blyth Spartans 1-2 Kidderminster Harriers Despite a spirited performance from an injury-hit Blyth Spartans, two goals on the counter-attack from the Harriers duo of Ryan Croasdale and Emmanuel Sonupé in a frantic second half condemned Spartans to a fifth straight Vanarama National League North defeat. Midfielder Sean…

VANARAMA NATIONAL LEAGUE NORTH Venue: Croft Park, Plessey Road, Blyth, Northumberland, NE24 3JE Date: Saturday 7th April 2018 Kick Off: 3pm ADMISSION Adults – £12 (£2 Additional for Port of Blyth Stand) Concessions – £6 (£2 Additional for Port of Blyth Stand) TEAM NEWS The Spartans welcome Kidderminster Harriers on Saturday, looking to get back to winning ways after suffering heavy defeats to Salford City and Harrogate…

There are just a few tickets remaining for the re-scheduled event to be held on Friday 13th April celebrating the FA Cup run during the 1977/78 season. Tickets are priced at £10 & include hot food & a free pin badge, which will be distributed on the night. Should you have any specific dietary requirements, please advise when purchasing your ticket. Tickets can be purchased from the general office on…

Blyth Spartans Vanarama National League North fixture against AFC Telford United – that was originally scheduled for last weekend – has been moved to Tuesday 17th April with a 7.45pm Kick-Off. The re-arrangement means Spartans will be tasked with playing three games in seven days – an away game at Chorley prior to the game with AFC Telford United and then Stockport County after it.

Report by Sam Donovan In association with: Alan McLean FCMA CGMA Chartered Management Consultant Vanarama National League North Monday 2nd April 2018 Harrogate Town 5 – 1 Blyth Spartans It was an afternoon to forget as Blyth were well and truly beaten as a superior Harrogate Town side enhanced their promotion hopes. McCombe headed the hosts into the lead on 10 minutes, Wright doubled the…

VANARAMA NATIONAL LEAGUE NORTH Venue: CNG Stadium, Harrogate, North Yorkshire, HG2 7SA Date: Monday 2nd April 2018 Kick Off: 3pm ADMISSION Adults: £14 Seated – £13 Standing Concessions: £10 Seated – £9 Standing Youths (U18’s): £5 Seated – £4 Standing TEAM NEWS Following another postponement on Saturday, Blyth will look to get back to winning ways as they travel to promotion hopefuls Harrogate Town on Easter Monday. The…

After an early morning pitch inspection by a local referee, today’s match against AFC Telford has been called OFF due to a waterlogged pitch. Watch this space for details of the re-arranged fixture.
